comments.body: Seems like now you can just do `tryParseDecimal(field)` alone at decimal case below.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +106,110 @@        case NullType => tryParseInteger(field)
        case IntegerType => tryParseInteger(field)
        case LongType => tryParseLong(field)
        case _: DecimalType => tryParseDecimal(field)
        case DoubleType => tryParseDouble(field)

comments.body: It looks slightly ugly that we handle special case of `Locale.US` for JSON inside of `ExprUtils.getDecimalParser` but for CSV outside of it. Maybe we unify the implementation, and  handle the special cases outside of generic implementation `ExprUtils.getDecimalParser` (or process both special cases inside of it)?
Yes.. we gotta do that I think .. Let's do that later when we drop the replacement thing entirely. I realised that CSV inference path alone handles it without replacement.
